title: The Heroin Diaries by Nikki Sixx
description:
In one of the most unique memoirs of addiction ever published, MÃƒÂ¶tley CrÃƒÂ¼e's Nikki Sixx shares mesmerizing diary entries from the year he spiraled out of control in a haze of heroin and cocaine, presented alongside riveting commentary from people who were there at the time, and from Nikki himself.

When MÃƒÂ¶tley CrÃƒÂ¼e was at the height of its fame, there wasn't any drug Nikki Sixx wouldn't do. He spent days Ã¢â‚¬â€ sometimes alone, sometimes with other addicts, friends, and lovers Ã¢â‚¬â€ in a coke and heroin-fueled daze. The highs were high, and Nikki's journal entries reveal some euphoria and joy. But the lows were lower, often ending with Nikki in his closet, surrounded by drug paraphernalia and wrapped in paranoid delusions.

Here, Nikki shares those diary entries Ã¢â‚¬â€ some poetic, some scatterbrained, some bizarre Ã¢â‚¬â€ and reflects on that time. Joining him are Tommy Lee, Vince Neil, Mick Mars, Slash, Rick Nielsen, Bob Rock, and a host of ex-managers, ex-lovers, and more.

Brutally...
